intro: Reseda valentina subsp. almijarensis, commonly known as the Almijar Valley Reseda, is a perennial herb native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, characterized by its small, cruciform flowers and often aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils, thriving in dry, sunny environments. Its leaves are lanceolate and covered with fine hairs, while its flowers are usually pale yellow or white. This subspecies is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and unique adaptations to its arid habitat.
